title: spack install command incorrectly returning 0 when failing
body:
I have a CI pipeline that builds a few packages daily to make sure that they keep building correctly. The CI script includes the following in a function:

```
spack install $PKGNAME
RET=$?
```

The script then reports the value of RET in a log file.

For the past week or so, I've been hit by [this issue](https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/20454), effectively making all my packages fail to build because automake-1.16.3 could not be built. The odd thing, however, is that Spack doesn't return an error code when failing to build a package.

Here is what spack displays (the package I'm trying to build is called mochi-margo):

```
==> Installing automake-1.16.3-2p5gwby4xivgjq2jwv6cnvjs5ou7k2r4
==> No binary for automake-1.16.3-2p5gwby4xivgjq2jwv6cnvjs5ou7k2r4 found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /sandbox/jenkins-ci/workspace/Mochi/mochi-all/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/ce/ce010788b51f64511a1e9bb2a1ec626037c6d0e7ede32c1c103611b9d3cba65f.tar.gz
==> automake: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> automake: Executing phase: 'configure'

==> automake: Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j16'

2 errors found in build log:
     99       GEN      bin/aclocal-1.16
     100      GEN      doc/aclocal-1.16.1
     101      GEN      bin/automake-1.16
     102      GEN      doc/automake-1.16.1
     103    help2man: can't get `--help' info from aclocal-1.16
     104    Try `--no-discard-stderr' if option outputs to stderr
  >> 105    make: *** [doc/aclocal-1.16.1] Error 126
     106    make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
     107    help2man: can't get `--help' info from automake-1.16
     108    Try `--no-discard-stderr' if option outputs to stderr
  >> 109    make: *** [doc/automake-1.16.1] Error 126

See build log for details:
  /sandbox/jenkins-ci/workspace/Mochi/mochi-all/.spack/stage/autotest/spack-stage-automake-1.16.3-2p5gwby4xivgjq2jwv6cnvjs5ou7k2r4/spack-build-out.txt

==> Warning: Skipping build of mochi-margo-0.9-u7muohgv2xx7ibr2udwusxgzyzwhwtj3 since automake-1.16.3-2p5gwby4xivgjq2jwv6cnvjs5ou7k2r4 failed
```

As you can see in the last line, spack skips the installation of the package I asked it to install, and returns 0, making my CI pipeline think that the package was built correctly.
